item.description:
"Children of Paradise" was awaded the Cesar of Cesars in the 1970's as the greatest French Film ever made. Hmm... I've never seen it, have you? This romantic drama is set in the 19th century Paris theater world where a beautiful actress has the attention of four different men ( a Count, a thief, a playwright and a mime) blurring the line between real life and stage. Filmed during the German occupation of France in WWII.
Here's a review that gives it 15 stars:
http://www.epinions.c...

After the film, we'll go to a local Harvard Sq. cafe to discuss.

Cost is $9 and I should note that this film is three hours long.
item.name: Voted Greatest French Film Ever at Cannes
